 According to The Real  Recovery Network’s progress notes from October 2002, Ms. Carter  was

To Whom It May Concern:  
 
Ms. Ava  Carter  is a 47 -year-old, single, woman  who has a history of bipolar disorder with major 
depression. Ms. Carter is an average sized (5’8”) woman of medium build. Ms. Carter has brown 
eyes and short black hair with a streak of gray . We first met Ms. Carter where she was sleeping under a bridge.
context_metadata.summary: Ava Carter, a 47-year-old woman, has a long-standing history of bipolar disorder, major depression, and substance abuse. She has faced significant challenges, including homelessness and chronic knee pain from a past injury. Ms. Carter has struggled with alcohol, marijuana, and crack cocaine as coping mechanisms for her mental health issues. Despite multiple treatment attempts, she has difficulty maintaining sobriety and managing her mental health. Her psychiatric evaluations show symptoms like racing thoughts, severe depression, and anxiety, and she has had issues with medication compliance, particularly during substance use.

context_metadata.chunk:
Ms. Carter wants to comply with treatment protocol, but due to the 
severity of her mental illness is unable to understand, remember or apply information. Ms. Carter’s thoughts are sometimes scattered because she often does not understand how to follow simple and routine instructions . She often repeats questions that she has just asked . She 
loses focus and does not seem to accept or remember answers to quest ions. When she was 
making notes of her treatment history, she wrote all over the sheet of paper in no particular order or spatial reasoning.

3 Ms. Carter has not been able to maintain full -time work because she is unable to learn and 
remember the new tasks of the job . The last  position she held was at Mary ’s Restaurant in 
Mobile  in January of 2003. She was fired after a couple of weeks because she was unable to 
perform her duties . She could not remember the abbreviations that were required for the job. Physical Health  
 Ms. Carter has been hospitalized a few times for physical health reasons.

2 abusive and so after 5 months, she moved out of the house into an apartment with her son. It was

Ms. Carter lived on the street when

 Ms. Carter left school in the 9
th grade when she ran away from her father’s house. When in

English and Grammar .

Ms. Carter ’s dis charge 
summary from October 2, 2002, recommends that she be placed in a Congregate Care Level II facility (highly structured environment with 24/7 staff supervision), which indicates her inability to care for herself independently .

She reports a number of fast -food jobs, such as 
McDonalds . She would cook the fries or clean the dining room . She would occasionally be asked 
to run the register, but would quickly be removed from those duties, as she would make too 
many errors . She reports that they would often take money from her check for those errors . Ms. 
Carter  would often lose her jobs because of her depression. She would not be able to get out of 
bed and go in to work and she would be fired for no- call, no- show .
